metadata.dc:author: Duclos, J
metadata.dc:description: Narrative medicine is becoming an increasingly popular way of communicating medical problems. This a letter that the author sends to a recently deceased patient. He describes his apprehensions on the use of invasive forms of diagnosis or treatments and the use of repeated hospital admissions in the context of a chronic and progressive disease. He also discusses the use of methods to "accelerate" death in suffering patients. He finally describes the dignity of his patient to face a chronic and debilitating condition.
metadata.dc:title: "A Milena" (un ensayo de medicina narrativa).
["To Milena" (A essay of narrative medicine)].
